page.title: 08GISLEHAM BRICKS AND PIPES
page.content: In the south west corner of our area is situated a brick and pipe works. The manufacture of {bricks} and clay pipes was carried on at this site until about 1981. At the centre of the site is a large pit from which the raw clay was extracted, first by manual labour, later by means of pneumatic shovels and, latterly, by means of mechanical diggers. Moulds were used to shape the clay into bricks. Some years ago the works ceased to make bricks as these could be purchased more cheaply from the London Brick Company and production was switched to making pipes for land drainage. This, in turn, ceased about 4 years ago when plastic pipes became cheaper. The buildings and kilns remain, together with some of the tools. The engines are still sometimes started and drive the machinery by means of air.
